result.execSummary:
The defendant Amanda L Hurd was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Amanda L Hurd

1:16 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Joey Roeth.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Roeth has received a copy of the revocation packet, with no corrections, additions or deletions.  State has received a copy of the revocation packet with no corrections, additions or deletions.  Sentencing statement by Atty Christenson.  Sentencing statement by Atty Roeth.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-120 days county jail, with huber and Out of county service and out of county travel. Sentence to commence immediately.
-Court grants 59 days of sentence credit.

Court orders the court costs and restitution be reduced to a civil judgement.

Court adjourned at 1:21 p.m.
By Atty Joey Roeth
Inmate Request to the Court
Sentencing hearing on revocation on August 23, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
and revocation summary
to counsel with a copy of the defendant's letter
from the defendant to Judge Slate

1:47 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to one count of Theft and the balance of the counts will be dismissed and read-in.  State concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged and orders the balance of the counts be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 12 months.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.
-Restitution - $385.80
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.
-NO Contact with the gas station in Markesan that is the victim of this crime.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.

Court adjourned at 1:54 p.m.
